revised_title: Ian Graham Gass: A Pioneering Geologist in the Fields of Seafloor Spreading Theory and Oceanic Crust Understanding
tldr: Ian Graham Gass was a renowned geologist who made significant contributions to the understanding of seafloor spreading theory and the nature of oceanic crust. His early work on the Troodos Massif in Cyprus played a crucial role in the development of seafloor spreading theory and the understanding of the oceanic crust. Gass's research led to Troodos becoming a model for "obducted" oceanic crust and mantle, which is now recognized in many other parts of the world.
